intro: Roepera tesquorum, commonly known as the Tesquorum roepera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Due to habitat loss, Roepera tesquorum is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
